p: Antigenotoxic evidence for broccoli and its main phytochemicals (sulforaphane, phenethyl isothiocyanate, allyl isothiocyanate, and indole-3-carbinol): After tomato, carrot, and celery, broccoli is the fourth most frequently consumed vegetable in the world. For this reason, there is great scientific interest in studying its biological effects, especially its DNA protective capacity [ 38].
